Blender-Python API Meshing

  • Blender is a free and open-source 3D computer graphics software toolset used for creating animated films, visual effects, art, 3D-printed models, motion graphics, interactive 3D applications, virtual reality, and, formerly, video games.

It is a tutorial to teach you how to create mesh by Blender-Python.

First of all, to be able to use the Blender-Python API, you need to import the bpy library.

When you open your new blender python, you can find a cube in the origin. And there is only one area for operating. What we are going to do is to create two new areas.

My Preference for Music

Pure music, or absolute music, is the music for its own sake‚Äîconcerned only with structure, melody, harmony, and rhythm.

Literally, I pay more attention on melody or harmony, rather than the lyrics. If I would like to listen to some songs with lyrics, I prefer those I don‚Äôt understand since I don‚Äôt really care about the meaning of the songs. Therefore, I don‚Äôt often listen to Chinese songs. As for me, lyrics are something more related to literature and distract me from concentrating on ‚Äúmusic‚Äù. Lyrics are just auxiliary tools. The impressive music can convey the emotion to audience through a single note, a chord, a modulation, a repeat, or even a pause.

Nomenclature for Music List

The ‚Äúpure‚Äù in my music list means that it is a list for pure music, and the following number in a year.month.day format means the date that I finished collecting 100 songs for the list. Then I will create a new list for selected music. Currently the number of songs in some lists is smaller than 100 due to copyright.
